name: Book Discussion: SEA ICE? NOW YOU DON'T! with Rohan Chakravarty and Menaka Raman| 24 AUGUST 5 PM
description: Join Rohan Chakravarty and Menaka Raman as they discuss Rohan's latest novel SEA ICE? NOW YOU DON'T! This is the third anthology of the multi-award winning series Green humour comics. From penguins balancing their nests on thin ice to tigers basking in their own glamour whilst worrying about their future, from ghazal-loving bats to whales dumping marine plastic waste right back at us, in SEA ICE? NOW YOU DON'T! you meet an array of wild animals with their own list of concerns, and their own brand of humour. The comics will take you from the high skies to geothermal mines in the very bottom of the ocean, and from sweltering tropical mangroves to the icy poles, engaging you in discussions about ecology, biology, nature conservation, and the politics of governing nature. This is a wild ride for sure, but NOT one which needs you to leave your brains at home! SEA ICE? NOW YOU DON'T!  is the third in the series of Green Humour collections, after ‘Green Humour for a Greying Planet’ and ‘Pugmarks and Carbon Footprints’, and includes comics published in periodic columns with platforms like   DW News ,   The Hindu ,   Roundglass Sustain , and   Gocomics. About the speakers Rohan Chakravarty is the creator of Green Humour, a series of comics and illustrations on wildlife and nature conservation. He lives in Nagpur where he goes on nature trails every day, led by his pet dogs Srishti and Sakshi.  Rohan has authored seven other books, including Green Humour for a Greying Planet, Naturalist Ruddy, and Pugmarks and Carbon Footprints. Although he has won awards by UNDP, Sanctuary Asia, WWF International, the Royal Bank of Scotland and the Green and Bangalore Literature Festivals for his work, a fig that once dropped out of a hornbill’s mouth straight into his palm remains his most cherished prize. His worst nightmare is that the wildlife featured in his comics will read them and gang up on him for revenge some day. Menaka Raman is the author of a number of books for children including HOW TO WIN AN ELECTION (A MOST UNRELIABLE GUIDE), WHAT DO WE NAME THIS DOG and THE FREEDOM SISTERS. Her novel LOKI TAKES GUARD won the Valley of Words Award for Writing for Young Adults. She is a regular contributor to The Hindu Sunday Magazine. name: Book Discussion: THE SPICE GATE with Prashanth Srivatsa and Lavanya Lakshminarayan | 25 AUGUST, 4 PM
description:
Join us at the bookstore to tune into this conversation between Prashanth Srivatsa and Lavanya Lakshminarayan as they discuss Prashanth's debut novel, THE SPICE GATE.  In this fantasy you follow Amir, a young man born with the ability to travel between eight kingdoms, and watch as he unravels the power that keeps the world in balance. It's a perfect read for those who've enjoyed Ken Liu’s Dandelion Dynasty, S.A. Chakraborty’s Daevabad Trilogy, and Andrea Stewart’s The Drowning Empire. The event details are as follows:  DATE: 25 AUGUST, SUNDAY TIME: 4 PM VENUE: CHAMPACA BOOKSTORE  You can  RSVP  here.  About the speakers  
 
 Prashanth Srivatsa  is a writer of fantasy and science fiction, based out of Bengaluru, India. Born in Coimbatore, educated in Mumbai and Delhi, and is currently working out of Bengaluru.  Prashanth’s fantasy and science-fiction short stories and novelettes have appeared in magazines such as Magazine of Fantasy and Science Fiction (F&SF), Asimov’s Science Fiction, Beneath Ceaseless Skies, Cast of Wonders, Heroic Fantasy Quarterly, among others.  
 Lavanya Lakshminarayan  is the author of THE TEN PERCENT THIEF. She’s the first Indian woman to be shortlisted for the prestigious Arthur C. Clarke Award, and is currently a finalist for the Subjective Chaos Kind of Award. She's also a Locus Award finalist, and the winner of the Times of India AutHer Award and the Valley of Words Award. Her short fiction has appeared in a number of magazines and anthologies, including THE BIG BOOK OF CYBERPUNK and TEH BEST OF WORLD SF: VOLUME 2. Lavanya is occasionally a game designer, and has built worlds for Zynga Inc.’s  FarmVille  and  Mafia Wars , among other games. Her next novel, INTERSTELLAR MEGACHEF, releases this November.
